intro: Racosperma profusum, commonly known as the common acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is a shrub or small tree, often with slender, compound leaves and yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including dry forests and woodlands, and is well adapted to arid conditions. Racosperma profusum plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various native animals.
